The university has international agreements with the Macquarie University Sydney in Australia, the University of Toronto in Canada, the Charles University in Prague, Czech Republic, the University of Helsinki in Finland, University Panthéon-Assas in France, Dresden University of Technology, Humboldt University in Berlin and Heidelberg University in Germany, Lomonosov Moscow State University in Russia, University of California in the US and many others.

Zagreb is the capital city of Croatia, with a population of 800,000. Its culture echoes both its Austro-Hungarian and Yugoslavian past. The city often hosts international music artists. It is also home to one of the biggest open air festivals in Europe, the INmusic festival, as well as the Zagreb Jazz Festival. Zagreb's resident are easily able to also visit cities such as Vienna and Budapest, along with many other famous places in central and eastern Europe.

name: University of Žilina
description:
The University of Žilina is a public university located in Žilina, Slovakia.

It first began as the College of Railways in 1953 and was subsequently renamed the University of Transport in 1959. It has been operating under its current name since 1996.

The university offers undergraduate, graduate and doctoral courses in wide range of subjects ranging from transport to marketing and humanities.

The University of Zilina is the only university located in the north western region of Slovakia.

The university is well known for its engineering programs and has research partnerships with universities across the world.

The university is involved in a wide array of scientific projects such as the TEMPUS, COST, National Scholarship Programme, and the DAAD. The university also actively organises several scientific and professional events and is working to deepen its engagement through its University Science Park and Research Centre.

The university has a large and modern campus located near the serene forest park in Žilina. It offers students a wide range of amenities such as relaxation zones, libraries, dormitories and cafeterias. There is are active student clubs which organise a wide range of events and activities every year.

name: University Rey Juan Carlos
description:
University Rey Juan Carlos is a Spanish public research university located in Madrid. It has four campuses across the city in Móstoles, Alcorcón, Vicálvaro and Fuenlabrada.

The institution is named after King Juan Carlos I of Spain and is a relatively new university having been established in 1996.

The university offers a number of undergraduate and postgraduate degrees as well as nine programmes taught in English.

There are also a number of university centres affiliated with the institution such as the Humanities Institute, the University Centre for Applied Social Studies and the Centre for Latin America Studies.

The university belongs to the Spanish Network of Healthy Universities, a group of institutions in Spain committed to the promotion of a health university environment.

The promotion of sustainability is also important on campus and there are a number of commitments towards energy efficiency, waste management and responsible consumption.

There are more than 30,000 students at the university with approximately 11 per cent international students from 80 different nationalities.

The university collaborates with a number of different associations and NGOs to present students with a range of volunteering opportunities during their study time. There are also volunteer programmes available in the university hospitals.

There are three thriving theatre groups open to students of all abilities and each group produces one show a year. Students can also join the choir and the orchestra if they have a passion for music.

Additionally, there are a number of sports teams that students can participate in, including basketball, handball, futsal, football, rugby and volleyball.

name: Urmia University of Technology
description:
Urmia University of Technology is a notable educational institution situated in Urmia, which is located in the West Azerbaijan province of Iran. This university was established in the year 2007, marking its presence as a relatively recent addition to Iran's higher education landscape.

The formation of Urmia University of Technology was a significant development, made possible by an independent budget allocated to the university. This budget was secured through the proposal of the Iranian government and subsequent approval by the Islamic parliament. Notably, this financial backing underline the government's commitment to fostering education and research in the fields of information technology (IT), mechanical engineering, and industrial engineering.

The university's academic and research activities officially commenced in February 2007, and it has since played a crucial role in providing higher education and research opportunities in these critical fields. Urmia University of Technology boasts a dedicated team of academic staff, with approximately 100 faculty members contributing to its educational mission.

This institution is situated in an urban campus in Urmia, making it accessible to students and researchers in the region. With a focus on technology-related disciplines and a commitment to advancing knowledge and innovation, Urmia University of Technology continues to contribute to the intellectual and technological growth of Iran.

name: USAMV Cluj-Napoca
description:
Established in 1869, the University of Agricultural Sciences and Veterinary Medicine of Cluj-Napoca (USAMV Cluj-Napoca) is based in Romania.

The university offers a range of undergraduate, postgraduate and doctorate programmes, across a variety of faculties including: agriculture, horticulture, animal husbandry and biotechnology, veterinary medicine and food science and technology.

The majority of courses are available in Romanian however a select few are taught in French and English.

USAMV Cluj-Napoca has advisory and career guidance services from specialised consultants to introduce students to companies for employment purposes. The aim is to prepare students for interviews as well as organising job placements during academic study.

On campus, students will find dormitories and restaurants for their use. Located on campus, there’s also an agro-botanical garden which has over 2,000 plant species across approximately three hectares. It’s a place designed to study botany and conserve the biodiversity of our planet.

There’s also an aquarium within the Faculty of Animal Husbandry and Biotechnology, Fisheries Department, which houses fish species including catfish, carp, pike, perch and bream.

Students can use the gymnasium, football field and tennis courts.

There are also plenty of student clubs for students to get involved with whether they have an interest in music, dance or community life.

The university offers a small number of scholarships designed to recognise and award academic excellence.

The university also has partnerships with other universities worldwide offering students the chance to spend a year studying abroad. These partnerships have also paved the way for faculty exchange and advanced research opportunities.

Partnered universities include University of Parma (Italy), Chiang May University (Thailand) and Vietnam National University of Agriculture (Vietnam).

name: Vietnam National University, Hanoi
description:
Vietnam National University, Hanoi was founded in 1906 and is a direct descendant of the colonial-era Universite de Indochinie.

Along with Vietnam National University, Ho Chi Minh City, it is "one of two leading multidisciplinary and multisectoral universities, tasked with producing highly qualified human resources for the rest of the country". They operate differently from the rest of Vietnam’s higher education, reporting directly to the prime minister, rather than to the education minister, and they have greater autonomy.

Vietnam National University, Hanoi took its current name and shape in 1993 with the merger of the University of Hanoi, the College of Foreign Languages and Hanoi National Union of Education. It is divided into 12 sub-sections called universities, plus two specialist schools for pupils with exceptional gifts in languages and the natural sciences.

It has the motto "Experience through Knowledge" and a vision that it is "expected to be one of the leading interdisciplinary, multidisciplinary research universities in the world which can contribute to national industrialisation and modernisation".

In 2016 the Vietnam Japan University was opened in order to "create a new momentum of socio-economic development and contribute to adding more value to Japanese investment in Vietnam" as "a centre of cultural and academic exchange between Vietnam and Japan".

The two training and research centres at the university are devoted to national defence and security and physical education and sports. High school students won medals at the 2019 Academic Olympiad for maths, biology and physics.

The university is based across six campuses, the largest at Vuan Thuy.

name: Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Nagpur
description:
Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, formerly the Visvesvaraya Regional College of Engineering, is an engineering and research oriented university in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India, Established in 1960, the institute is one of 30 National Institutes of Technology in the country.

There are three departments: architecture and planning, basic science and engineering. Across these departments, students can choose from a variety of courses from computer science to physics to English among others. Students are offered courses at undergraduate, postgraduate and doctorate levels.

Students have access to a range of campus facilities, including an auditorium, gymnasium, community shops, clubs and library, as well as facilities for sports including tennis, football, hockey and badminton.

The institute encourages and supports entrepreneurial students, offering the E-cell, with student intensive, learning-oriented programs to help with start-ups and product design. There is also the Consortium, usually a three-day summit, organising keynote speakers, competitions and student meetings. The institute is committed to helping students gain industry placements and employment both during and after their studies, working with both local and multinational companies, including: Goldman Sachs, Lowe’s India and JP Morgan.

Nagpur is known as the Orange City,  famous for its orange trade and production, as well as being known as the tiger capital of India for having several tiger reserves in the city, and being home to the regional office of the National Tiger Conservation Authority. Students and visitors have a variety of sights and attractions to visit, such as: the Swaminarayan Temple, Pench Tiger Reserve, and Futala Lake.

name: VSB - Technical University of Ostrava
description:
Founded in 1849, VSB - Technical University of Ostrava (VSB-TUO) is a Czech public institution that boasts a rich history of high-quality engineering education and research. VSB-TUO emphasises applied research and maintains strong ties with industry, collaborating nationally and globally to develop innovative solutions to modern challenges.

VSB-TUO's commitment to fostering a supportive environment for researchers has earned it theHR Excellence in Research Award. TheInternational Contact Pointfurther supports this commitment by offering comprehensive services to help international staff and students adapt to life in the Czech Republic, including assistance with visas, housing, banking, healthcare, and more.

Social responsibility is a fundamental value at VSB-TUO. We integratesustainability principlesinto all our activities, from research to education, to help protect our planet and improve the quality of life. Together with our partners in different fields, we seek innovations that enable sustainable development for today's and future generations.

Study at VSB-TUO

VSB-TUO currently offersBachelor’s,Master’s, andPhDprogrammes for more than 12,000 students in engineering, IT, technology, economics, and business administration.Seven facultiesprovide a range of courses, including manyEnglish-taught options for exchange students. Practical training is central to the curriculum, with around 50% of coursework practice-oriented, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for the global job market. Furthermore, thePhD Academyoffers courses to help doctoral students develop key skills for their scientific careers.

The University follows the European Bologna Declaration and uses the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS), facilitating student mobility and international degree recognition. VSB-TUO offersscholarshipsfor international students in English-taught degree programmes and provides affordable, well-equippeddormswith internet in every room, cooking facilities, and a perfect location on campus.

TheErasmus Student Networksupports international students, organising orientation days, trips, educational events, and much more.

Research Excellence

VSB-TUO is a national leader in High-Performance Computing and energy systems, integrating cutting-edge technologies such as 5G network to connect key infrastructure including our supercomputer centre, smart factory, e-health system, 3D printing, and a vast sensor network. This creates a dynamic Live Industry 4.0 Laboratory. The University's research mission focuses on fostering excellent science, research, and innovation, particularly in interdisciplinary R&D activities such as HPC, Industry 4.0, and Energy Research.

The University collaborates internationally, including a notable partnership with the Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft, establishing theFraunhofer Innovation Platform for Applied Artificial Intelligence for Materials & Manufacturing. This partnership aims to advance the great potential of energy management technologies, artificial intelligence, and intelligent production in industry.

Four Fundamental Pillars of R&D

Engineering and Technology

Electrical │ Mechanical Materials │ Civil │ Safety and Security │ Biomedical and Biomechanical │ Environmental and Brownfields Management │Chemical │ Geological │ Geodesy and Geoinformatics │ Automotive │ Acoustical │ Transport Technology and Technics │ Nanotechnology │ Additive Technology

Computer Science and Cyber Physical Systems

Artificial intelligence │ Machine Learning │ Computer Vision and Image Processing │ Software and Process Engineering │ High-Performance Computing │ High-Performance Data Analysis │ Computational and Applied Mathematics │ Industry 4.0 │ Robotics

Energy and Raw Materials

Renewable Energy │ Energy Accumulation │ High-Capacity Storage Systems │ Artificial Intelligence in Energy Management │ Energy Diagnostics │ Electromobility │ Energy Raw Materials and Their Processing

Economic and Financial Processes

Economics │ Finance │ Management Science │ Business Administration

VSB-TUO is Home to Two Major Research Institutes

IT4Innovations National Supercomputing Center(IT4Innovations)

IT4Innovations is a leading research, development, and innovation centre active in the fields of High-Performance Computing (HPC), Data Analysis (HPDA), Quantum Computing (QC), and Artificial Intelligence (AI) and their application to other scientific fields, industry, and society. IT4Innovations operates the most powerfulsupercomputing systemsin the Czech Republic. The key research areas include:

Centre for Energy and Environmental Technologies(CEET)

CEET as an excellent research interdisciplinary institute at VSB – Technical University of Ostrava, founded in 2021, brings under one roof four research centres :the ENET Centre,the Nanotechnology Centre,the Institute of Environmental Technologyandthe Energy Research Centre. The research agenda is focused on the Materials for Energy and Environmental Technologies, Energy Utilisation of Secondary Raw Materials and Alternative Energy Sources, Energy Storage, Transformation and Management and Environmental Aspects and Technologies. With a strength of over 250 scientists and researchers, CEET is committed to conducting from basic to applied research with excellent results and their implementation in practical use. Together we develop new materials and technologies for low-carbon and sustainable energy and environmental technologies in accordance with the principles of the circular economy. Our common strategy is energy transformation, a topic that cuts across all areas of our lives, from transport to industry and the environment. Like the rest of the world, we are searching for emission-free sources while at the same time looking for solutions that avoid generating additional waste and fill-up landfills.

Campus Life

VSB-TUO boasts the largestcampusin the Czech Republic and one of the largest in Central Europe, situated in the pleasant surroundings of Ostrava-Poruba, near a forest with paths for inline skating and cycling. The campus features cafes, sports facilities (beach-volleyball and tennis courts, football pitches, etc.), alibrary, a student relax zone, an art gallery, ageological pavilion, and an observatory and planetarium. These facilities host various events open to the public, including exhibitions, fairs, film screenings, concerts, and educational activities. The campus is well-connected by public transport to other parts of Ostrava.

Life in Ostrava

Ostrava, Czechia’s third-largest city, is a vibrant university hub where students make up about 10% of the population. The city offers numerous cultural and entertainment options, with excellent public transport links within the city and to major European capitals.  Ostrava is also home to theColours of OstravaandBeats for Lovemusic festivals, which host artists from around the world every summer.

name: Vytautas Magnus University
description:
Vytautas Magnus University was founded in 1922. It was initially known as the University of Lithuania and was renamed to Vytautas Magnus University to commemorate 500 years of the death of Vytautas the Great, the Lithuanian ruler.

The university has ties with many universities in North America, Europe and East Asia such as the University of Bergen, University of Urbino, Fordham University and Kyung Hee University.

There are 13 academic divisions within the university including the faculty of economics and management, faculty of arts and the faculty of social sciences among others. The university adopts a liberal arts approach to learning.

The art spaces within the university are used as settings for cultural events for the entire city. This includes the Kaunas Jazz Festival and the International Festival of Modern Dance.

name: Walailak University
description:
Walailak University (WU), founded in 1992,is located in the province of Nakhon Si Thammarat, in the upper south of Thailand, a historical province with multi-cultural society, around 2.30 hrs. by car from Samui Island in Surathani and 5 hrs away from Phuket, 2 world’s popular tourist attractions in the south of Thailand. The university is an autonomous public research-intensive university; all lecturers are working annually to contribute to quality research publication in Q1 and Q2 Scopus-indexed journals.  The university aims at improving her quality in all institutional facets: academics, research productivity and quality, healthcare, and environment.

Academic Excellence

International Rankings Achievements

In her persisting attempts for world-quality education, Walailak University, one of nineteen universities among the total of about 200 universities in Thailand, has achieved several world rankings: 1201-1500 for Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings 2024, 501+ for THE Young University Rankings, and 801-1000 for THE Subject Rankings for Clinical and Health and for Life Sciences and 1001+ for Physical Sciences.

Leading National Educational Quality

At the national level, WU, adopting ASEAN University Network Quality Assurance standard as the institute quality assessment criteria in 2022, achieved the overall academic administration score of 5 (indicating the better performance than the standard score of 4) from the highest score of 7. Moreover, in terms of the university strategic enforcement for world excellence, WU was awarded the score of 6.47.

World-class Quality Teaching

Valuing the significance of high quality teaching, since 2018 Walailak University has been working closely with the UK-based Advance Higher Education (AdvanceHE) to have all her lecturers internationally certified as high-quality higher education professionals. Currently, 650 (97.01%) WU faculty members have now been awarded varying levels of the United Kingdom Professional Standard Framework fellowship (UKPSF) – 1 Principal Fellow (PHEA), 71 Senior Fellows (SFHEAs) and 578 Fellows (FHEAs).

On world-certified professional basis, our lecturers now emphasize in their teaching, attention to individual learning of students, formative assessment and feedback, and analytical and critical thinking. The university believes in the strong relationship between high-quality teaching and high-quality graduates.

Nearly 150 small and hi-tech “smart” classrooms, currently ready to serve both students and lecturers, will further enhance the quality of teaching and learning.

Work-integrated Cooperative Education

One of WU outstanding quality education feature tailored for the 21st century, where creativity, critical thinking, digital and media literacy, global mindedness, communication efficiency are keys, is the 8-month long work-integrated cooperative education of students’ choices worldwide during their senior year.  The work-integrated experiences promote WU students’ professional opportunities after their graduation.

International Programs

WU is offering international programs both at the bachelor’s degree and at the graduate level.BA degree programsinclude Walailak University International College of Dentistry, Akkhraratchakumari Veterinary College, Walailak University International College (WUIC) and Medical Technology Program under the School of Allied Health Sciences.International graduate programsinclude several fields in health sciences, science and technology and social sciences.  More information can be reached at College of Graduate Studies.  To promote international education as well as post graduate fellowships, WU also supports several scholarships for international students; information is available atscholarships for BA degreesandscholarships for graduate studies.

Opportunities for short international exchanges are also available; information can be reached by contacting Walailak University International College Homepage and by contacting the Center for International Affairs via the emailinteraffairs.wu@gmail.comorinteraffairs.wu@mail.wu.ac.th.

World Research Leadership

Among all peer higher education institutes in Thailand, WU has achieved the highest volume of quality Q1 and Q2 research publications in Scopus-indexed journals. Additionally, WU international research collaboration is currently 42.5 percent. WU is home for 5 researchers listed in 2023 World’s Top2% Scientist named by Stanford University in Materials, Tropical Medicine, Electrical & Electronic Engineering, and Food Science. Besides, as part of the leading global and frontier research universities, classified by the Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation, WU focuses on 4 main areas of research: high-valued agriculture and processed food production, herbal medicine, tourism and creative economy, and digital and artificial intelligence technologies.24 WU research excellence centersare open doors for all enthusiastic researchers around the world; should you intend to join our research teams, please contact the Center for International Affairs atinteraffairs.wu@gmail.comorinteraffairs.wu@mail.wu.ac.th.

Healthcare

To promote quality healthcare both for WU community members and for the locals in the upper south of Thailand, in 2021 WU established a teaching hospital named “Walailak University Hospital,” (WUH) a healthcare facility of 426 inpatient units with advanced medical devices.

International medical students and professionals interested in short medical rotation opportunities can also contact the Center for International Affairs atinteraffairs.wu@gmail.comorinteraffairs.wu@mail.wu.ac.th.

Best Green Environment

WU also focuses on transforming the physical environment both to make it eco-friendly and to turn it into the most beautiful university in Thailand.    As evidence of WU’s attempt to be the best green university, UI Green Metric World University Ranking 2023 awarded WU the best among universities in the southern Thailand for four consecutive years, the 6th in the country and the 83rd in the world.

Additionally, WU has also achieved 2023 Times Higher Education Impact Rankings, attesting WU’s efforts to enforce the United Nation’s sustainability development goals, at the band of 401-600.  Four of the leading goals among the top 100 of the world rank WU is proud of include zero hunger, clean water and sanitation, sustainable cities and communities, and life below water.

name: Warsaw University of Technology
description:
The Warsaw University of Technology dates back to the early 19th century, when technical schools – related to engineering, military technology and mining – were first established in Poland. The Preparatory School for the Polytechnic Institute was founded in Warsaw by Stanislaw Staszic, and this became the Warsaw University of Technology in 1915, with the faculties of Architecture, Machine Design and Electrical Engineering.

Today, it is one of the largest technical institutes in Central Europe with 19 faculties – including Automotive and Construction Machinery Engineering, Electronics and Information Technology and Mechatronics – and one college, nearly 35,000 students and more than 2,000 academic teachers. The most popular fields of study in 2015 were geoinformatics, automatic control and robots, and biomedical engineering. The top three areas of study for employers were computer science, administration and management.

The university aims to anticipate what the future might be in terms of economic and cultural conditions by having a clear understanding of the present, and to come up with technological solutions to whatever problems may arise. To this end it places a strong emphasis on research, community between teachers and students, and academic freedom. In 2015, the university conducted more than 500 national and international research projects, with the intention of understanding the fast-changing and increasingly complex world.

name: Wilfrid Laurier University
description:
Wilfrid Laurier University inspires students to lead lives of leadership and purpose. Laurier is focused on a holistic approach to education and an unwavering commitment to academic excellence that prepares our graduates to excel in the future. Our forward-thinking academic programs in business and economics, science, music, arts, social science and humanities, social work and education, provide opportunities for hands-on experience in and outside the classroom as well as ground-breaking research initiatives. Community is the heartbeat of our institution. Our vibrant community of over 20,000 students is spread across our close-knit campuses in Waterloo, Brantford and Milton, where students develop meaningful connections with their professors and peers, actively engage in campus life, and cultivate a sense of belonging. This unique student experience sets Laurier apart. Driven by a commitment to excellence, our passionate students, alumni, educators, researchers, and leaders tackle some of society's most pressing challenges, leading positive change worldwide. Learn more about Laurier’s campuses in Waterloo, Brantford and Milton and our locations in Kitchener, Toronto and Yellowknife.

Wilfrid Laurier University is devoted to excellence in learning, research, scholarship and creativity. It challenges people to become engaged and aware citizens of an increasingly complex world. It fulfills its mission by advancing knowledge, supporting and enhancing high-quality undergraduate, graduate and professional education, and emphasizing co-curricular development of the whole student.

name: Woosong University
description:
Based in Daejeon, Woosong University opened in 1995.

It is based on three adjacent campuses – West, East and Sol Bridge – close to Daejeon Railway state, an important junction in the national network. Most activities are concentrated on the West campus.

The university has a range of schools including software convergence, health and welfare, hotel and culinary, railroad transportation and the graduate school.

They supplement the three specialist international schools – the SolBridge International School of Business, the Endicott School of International Studies and the JW Kim School of Future Studies set up in 2020.

International students have a choice of two residences, the International Dormitory on West Campus and Sol-Geo on the East.

There are two graduation ceremonies each year.

name: Wrocław University of Science and Technology
description:
Wrocław University of Science and Technology (WUST) is a leading research and teaching center and one of the most dynamically developing technical universities in Poland. The education offered by the university is strongly linked with scientific research and the needs of the economy and is consistent with standards of the European Higher Education Area. Wroclaw University of Science and Technology rates high in the annual rankings of Polish universities and is an inheritor of the intellectual and research traditions of the Lvov Polytechnic. Since the very beginning of its existence, the university has been an important center of technical education. Today, it belongs to the best technical universities in Poland – almost 23 000 students study here under the guidance of 2 287 academic teachers, at the 14 faculties in Wroclaw and three branches in Walbrzych, Jelenia Gora and Legnica.

Mission Statement:Through research, teaching, and collaboration we inspire and support the development of individuals who, based on knowledge, ethical standards and displaying sensitivity to the needs of society and global challenges, shape the future with courage and responsibility.

name: Wuhan Textile University
description:
Wuhan Textile University has a history that dates back to 1958 when its predecessor, Wuhan Institute of Textile Engineering was established. In 1999 the institute was renamed Wuhan University of Science and Engineering. Eleven years later, the former Hubei Foreign Trade School merged with the Hubei Academy of Finance and Economics to become Wuhan Textile University.

The university is located in Wuhan, a city in central China.

There are four faculties within the university: faculty of engineering and physical sciences, faculty of arts, faculty of management, and the faculty of humanities. Each faculty is divided into different schools, which offer a variety of both undergraduate and graduate degree programmes.

The university has developed partnerships with a number of other higher education institutions across the globe including the University of Madeira in Portugal, the University of North Carolina at Greensboro in the US and the Mawlana Bhashani Science and Technology University in Bangladesh.

name: Xiangtan University
description:
Xiangtan University (XTU)is a comprehensive university initiated by the great man Mao Zedong, who also inscribed the university's name and entrusted the university administrators to "do their utmost to build a successful university". It was founded in 1958 and was recognized as one of the first-batch national comprehensive universities with 15 other universities by the Ministry of Education in 1978. Today, XTU is jointly sponsored by Hunan Provincial People's Government, the Ministry of Education and the State Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense.

Covering an area of 92.2 hectares, XTU consists of 22 full-time colleges with 1462 full-time faculty members. Over 70% of the faculty members boast senior professional titles or doctoral degrees and 25% of them have overseas experience on research and study. Two of them are CAE (Chinese Academy of Engineering) academicians. As far as research is concerned, the university ranks 70th among universities of China in terms of research papers on SCI, EI and international citations, and 12th in 2017 in the projects of National Social Science Fund. In addition, it has launched 925 items of industry-university-research cooperation projects.

At present, the university’s full-time student enrollment of all majors totals 31,317, including 6,429 doctoral and master’s degree candidates. And it has 8 first level disciplines authorized to offer doctorate degrees in philosophy, law, theoretical economics, mathematics, statistics, materials science and engineering, chemical engineering, and public administration. It also has 30 first level disciplines authorized to offer master’s degrees, 13 professional master’s degree categories and 11 post-doctoral research centers. Of these disciplines, 4 rank among thetop 1%of  global universities and research institutions onESI (chemistry, materials science, engineering, and mathematics),3 are labeled as national key disciplines and 4 as the characteristic disciplines of national defense.Click HERE to find out more.

The university’s prowess in talent-cultivating is particularly noteworthy: One third of 88 bachelor’s degree programs are recognized as the national and provincial characteristic specialties, key specialties, experimental specialties of national comprehensive reform, and relevant specialties of national strategic new industries. Moreover, the university’s undergraduate education was rated as excellent by the Ministry of Education both in 2002 and 2008. The university was also identified as one of the 50 “model universities in graduate employment” in China. For over 40 years, the university has cultivated 230,000 talents of various majors for national and local economic development, ranking the 45th in the aggregate indicator list of national talents cultivation quality project in China. With 3 academicians as our outstanding alumni, the university has cultivated a large number of experts and scholars, men of letters, business elites, party and government leaders.

Over the past years, XTU has been expanding its exchange and cooperation with over 60 international renowned universities in more than 20 countries such as USA, Japan and Australia, undertaking 35 international cooperation programs. It has founded two Confucius Institutes respectively in Leon University in Spain and Makerere University in Uganda, and it has been selected by Ministry of Education as one of the universities to carry on the China-Africa “20 + 20” Colleges Cooperation Program. With frequent international communication, the overseas students number in the university has been increasing with a rate as high as 38% in recent 3 years.

Scholarship Opportunities:  Candidates are welcome to apply for XTU and apply for the following scholarships for overseas students via the university: Chinese Government Scholarship, “The Belt and Road” Scholarship sponsored by Hunan Provincial Government, Xiangtan University Scholarship, and China-Africa “20 + 20” Colleges Cooperation Program Scholarship.

Job Opportunities:  XTU sincerely recruits domestic and foreign high-level talents, and all high-level talents enrolled can enjoy career establishment, settling-in allowance and scientific research starting allowance.

name: Yanshan University
description:
Yanshan University (YSU) is a provincially run university in Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China. It began life as the Harbin Institute of Technology (HIT) in 1920, which was moved to the industrial town of Fulaerji, Qiqihar in northeast China’s Heilongjiang Province and then renamed the School of Heavy Machinery of HIT.

It gained independence as the Northeast Heavy Machinery Institute and moved southward to the historic resort city of Qinhuangdao in 1985. It was accredited by the former State Education Commission in 1997 and adopted the name Yanshan University.

The university’s campus covers 330 hectares and has a student population of 37,000, with a faculty and staff team of 2,700.

YSU consists of 18 schools and one independent department: school of mechanical engineering; school of material science and engineering; school of electrical and electronic engineering; school of information technology and engineering; school of economics and management; school of civil engineering and mechanics; school of sciences; school of humanities and law; school of foreign languages; school of environmental and chemical engineering; school of fine arts; school of automotive and energy engineering; school of postgraduate studies; school of international exchange; Li Ren School; school of vocational training; school of continuous education; the school of defense technology; and department of physical education.

Qinhuangdao City, where Yanshan University is based, is a coastal resort city 260 km northeast of Beijing. It is one of China’s most popular tourist destinations, attracting visitors from China and across the world. Highlights include the beginning of the Great Wall (or Lao Longtou), the First Pass Under Heaven (the Shanhai Guan) on the Great Wall, the summer resort Beidaihe Beach, the sandy Golden Beach at the Nandaihe area, the safari zoo, and many other scenic spots which are easy to access.

name: Yaşar University
description:
Yaşar Universitywas established on March 29, 2001, by the Selçuk Yaşar Sports and Education Foundation. Inspired by the principles of "Science, Unity, Success" set forth by Selçuk Yaşar, founder of the Yaşar Group, the university began its academic journey in İzmir with a strong commitment to contributing to education, science, and society.

The university is located in İzmir, a major city in western Anatolia, Turkey. As the third largest city in the country, İzmir lies along the Aegean coast and has a deep-rooted history that dates back to ancient times when it was known as the Greek city of Smyrna. Over the centuries, it has been home to Greeks, Armenians, Levantines, and Turks. Today, its cultural richness is reflected in well-preserved archaeological landmarks such as the Roman Agora of Smyrna, Mount Kadifekale, and the historical Asansör Tower.

Yaşar University has demonstrated its academic and institutional success through its placement in various national and international rankings. It has been recognized as the leading university in the Aegean Region in several lists published by respected ranking organizations such as Times Higher Education (THE). With its strong stance in areas such as education quality, internationalization, sustainability, and research performance, the university has also secured a prestigious position among universities across Turkey.

Since its foundation, Yaşar University has evolved into a dynamic institution with a student-centered structure and a strong international vision. Through its student-focused approach, English-medium instruction, and practice-based learning model, the university offers its students a wide range of opportunities for holistic development.

The university comprises 8 faculties, 1 School of Applied Sciences, 1 Vocational School, 1 School of Foreign Languages, and 1 Graduate School. It offers a total of 30 undergraduate and 13 associate degree programs. Education is provided in diverse fields such as law, psychology, engineering, communication, art and design, gastronomy, business, architecture, and agricultural sciences. Yaşar University has approximately 8,300 students and 635 academic staff. Most students begin their education at the English Preparatory School. Students are expected to meet a certain level of English proficiency before starting their departmental courses.

The university places great importance on internationalization. Within the scope of the Erasmus+ program, it has agreements with 228 universities in 27 European countries. Additionally, through Global Exchange and ISEP programs, students have the opportunity to study at universities in 24 different countries, particularly in the United States.

Yaşar University aims to prepare its students not only for life after graduation but also for the business world during their studies. With the YU-COOP (Yaşar University Cooperative Education Program) model, students gain sectoral experience throughout their education and begin their careers with a strong foundation. Students who wish to do so may also pursue double major or minor programs to obtain an additional diploma or certificate in a different field.

Campus life is an integral part of the university experience. A total of 56 student clubs organize events in various fields such as art, sports, entrepreneurship, and environmental awareness. Through these clubs, students develop skills in leadership, organization, and project management while receiving support from academic and administrative advisors.

The university offers a variety of scholarships and tuition discounts. These include scholarships for tuition, academic achievement, talent, accommodation, and special support for the families of martyrs and veterans. Additional financial support is also provided through staff and family discounts. All scholarships and discounts are administered in accordance with the university’s official regulations.

Alumni relations are one of the university’s key priorities. To date, Yaşar University has graduated 18,196 students, approximately 70% of whom are employed. Alumni hold positions in national and international companies across sectors such as engineering, software, communication, finance, design, and production.

With its integrated approach to academic excellence, sectoral experience, and social development, Yaşar University is committed to educating well-rounded, conscious, and globally minded individuals.

name: Yazd University
description:
Founded in 1976, Yazd University is a non-profit public institution located in the Iranian city and province of the same name. The institution offers degrees in electrical, mining and metallurgical, civil, mechanical, computer, industrial, textile, chemical and polymer engineering; economics, management, accounting, social sciences, languages and literature, psychology and educational sciences, theology, geography, law and political sciences; physics, mathematics, chemistry, biology, geology; environmental sciences. In addition, the especially respected School of Art and Architecture offers degrees in painting, art, urban planning and architecture.

You can enroll at Yazd University by passing an admissions exam.

Yazd University covers an area of 380 hectares which spreads across the city of Yazd, with a population of 500,000, as well as Saduq, Hamidiya, Zarach and Shahediyeh. The city of Yazd has a splendid unique architecture adapted to the desert surroundings. Its Zoroastrian fire temples, Jame Mosque with Persian mosaics and the highest minarets in the country, its wind towers and silk weaving have made the name of this city. Yazd is also one of the few big cities built of adobe.

Yazd is formally affiliated with the Islamic faith.

name: Yokohama National University
description:
Yokohama National University (YNU) can trace its history back nearly 150 years to the founding of its predecessor school in Yokohama, Japan’s second city and principal port.

In 1949 it became a Japanese National University after incorporating two local institutions as well as the Yokohama College of Economics and the Yokohama Institute of Technology.

Yokohama National University has, since then, incorporated several other institutions and is now home to five graduate schools and four undergraduate faculties. It encourages students and members of staff to uphold what it calls its four fundamental principles: “Be Active,” “Be Innovative,” “Be Open” and “Be Global.”

The university sprawls over a large, leafy campus in the heart of Yokohama city. Yokohama itself is a vibrant, bustling metropolis. Described as Japan’s "gateway to the world" it was among the first ports in Japan to open itself to international trade and as a result Yokohama has an international, cosmopolitan feel.

YNU perpetuates this history of international exchange and cooperation via its collaborations with foreign institutions and its suite of international programmes, which currently host students from more than 50 different countries.

International programmes are taught in English at the undergraduate and postgraduate level and offer international students the chance to study and experience life in a vibrant Japanese city.

Notable alumni of Yokohama National University are the chemist Akira Fujishima Chemist; Katsuhiko Kawasoe, a former president and chief executive officer of Mitsubishi Motors; Masaya Nakamura, the founder of Namco Co. and the so-called "father of Pacman"; and the film director Shunji Iwai.

name: Zewail City of Science and Technology
description:
Zewail City of Science, Technology and Innovation (ZC) is a non-profit, public higher education institutions and one of the leading institutions of learning, research and innovation in Egypt. Established by the late Nobel laureate Ahmed Zewail in 2012, Zewail City aims to build a scientific renaissance in Egypt and enrich the society with the latest technologies and research that will contribute to solving our strategic challenges. The City’s structure and operation is centered around research-based education, focusing on excellence in education and research, within selected areas of Engineering and Science aligned with local and global industrial and market needs.

Zewail City has its own unique comprehensive structure consisting of three pillars;

•	The University of Science and Technology•	Six Research Institutes•	Valley of Science and Technology.

The University of Science and Technology

The university features 3 main schools; Science, Engineering and Computational Science schools, which, between them offer 12 programs, focusing on excellence in education and research. The university has a competitive admissions process ensuring the excellence of our admitted students. The University also offers M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees through various graduate programs that have a direct link to the research directions pursued by our faculty members in the university and the research institutes.

Research Institutes

With six research institutes featuring 13 research centers and covering diverse disciplines of research; Biomedical Sciences, Nanoscience and Informatics, Imaging and Visualization, Basic Sciences, Energy and Environment, Zewail City  has a distinguished record of high research output focusing on innovation and excellence in research.

Valley of Science and Technology

The Valley of Science and Technology in Zewail City is a technology park that will constitute the area of confluence between R&D and the market. The Valley has two primary functions. It will provide gifted graduates and technology entrepreneurs the opportunity to incubate and develop new technologies and industries. Zewail City of Science and Technology will provide some financial assistance and appropriate space on a contractual basis to enhance the level of entrepreneurship and aid in the establishment of new industries.

name: Zhejiang Chinese Medical University
description:
Zhejiang Chinese Medical University is situated in Zhejiang Province and was established in 1953.

It is a collaborative effort of the Zhejiang Provincial Government, the State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine, and the Bureau of Education.

Initially known as Zhejiang Traditional Chinese Medicine Training School, it was later renamed Zhejiang College of Traditional Chinese Medicine in 1959. The university obtained the right to confer doctoral degrees in 1998 and moved to Hangzhou Binjiang Higher Education Park in March 2000, expanding its infrastructure and academic offerings.

Today, the university has a large campus with modern facilities. It offers programmes including doctoral and master's degree programmes in traditional Chinese medicine, integrated traditional Chinese and western medicine, basic medicine, clinical medicine, pharmacy, nursing and many more.

Zhejiang Chinese Medical University recruits and trains graduate students in traditional Chinese medicine. It is also among the first institutions in Zhejiang Province to have post-doctoral research stations.

To encourage more international students to study at the university it offers various scholarships, including the Zhejiang Provincial Government Scholarship for Overseas Students in China, Zhejiang University of Traditional Chinese Medicine Scholarship for Overseas Students, and Zhejiang University of Traditional Chinese Medicine President Scholarship.

name: Zhejiang University of Finance and Economics
description:
Zhejiang University of Finance and Economics was established in 1974. The university is centred around finance and economics with focuses on science, engineering, liberal arts, law, arts and philosophy. There are four campuses, with the main campus located in the city of Hangzhou, China. The university’s first campus buildings were rented from silkworm producing farms in Qibao Town.

Upon its founding, the university was known as the Zhejiang College of Public Finance and Banking, however in 1987 the university was renamed with approval of the former State Education Commission and in 2013 its current name was officially adopted in line with the Ministry of Education’s approval. The university began offering bachelor’s degrees in 1991, master’s in 2003 and doctorate degrees in 2018.

Across the university’s 16 schools and three research institutions, there are 45 undergraduate bachelor programmes, 54 postgraduate master’s programmes, and six doctorate programmes. The schools and departments include: public finance and taxation; public management; accounting; finance; information management and artificial intelligence; economics; law; foreign languages; data sciences; humanities; arts; and physical education.

Students at the university have a range of international opportunities through exchanges and partnerships. The university has links with over 135 universities across 33 countries, allowing for knowledge exchange and study abroad initiatives.

name: Abdelmalek Essaâdi University
description:
Abdelmalek Essaâdi University was established in 1989. The campus is spread across the Tanger-Tetouan-AL Hoceima region and the city of Larache in Morocco. The university gets its name from the Sultan, Abu Marwan And al-Malik.

Abdelmalek Essaâdi University has a range of schools and faculties including: applied sciences, economics and social sciences, education, human sciences, technical sciences among others. The main teachin language at the university is French.

There are a range of student clubs available at the university including sports teams, volunteering groups, art club, journalism club and and entrepreneurship club.

The careers centre was established in 2016 with the aim of offering training for skills students need in the world of work. The university also established the third Confucious Institute in Morocco, providing students with the opportunity to learn the Chinese language.

name: Acharya Nagarjuna University
description:
A public affiliated university, with a wide range of affiliates spread across the state of Andhra Pradesh, Acharya Nagarjuna University's underlying purpose is to enable postgraduate study close to home for students from the southern coastal region of the state. It operates under the motto "everything is established in truth".

While it does run undergraduate courses, particularly through nearly 400 affiliates, it continues to be defined by postgraduate work, and in particular two-year masters courses. Ten such courses were offered in 1976 when it attained university status, nine years after being founded as a branch of Andhra University.

Divided between colleges of arts and science, a total of 47 options are now offered – 39 from the main campus at Namburu, on National Highway 16 north of Guntur City, and four each from satellite centres at Nuzvid and Ongole. Recent additions include courses in Hindi and tourism and travel, while it was one of three universities in the state chosen in 2015 to run courses in Japanese.

Research centres focus on disaster mitigation, women’s studies, scientific socialism, Afro-Asian philosophies, social policy and Mahayama Buddhism, of which Acharya Nagarjuna, who lived in the second and third centuries, was a co-founder. A National Legal Research Centre is at the planning stage.

While rooted in ancient traditions, ANU also has a taste for cutting-edge modernity shown in the experimental creation of a blockchain-based "ANU University Token" to enable students to pay for food, books and tuition. Much of the campus is powered by solar energy following the creation of a pilot generation scheme.

name: Acıbadem University
description:
A private institution located on the Asian side of Istanbul, Acıbadem University takes both its name and most of its character from its relationship with the Acıbadem Health Group, one of Turkey’s largest healthcare companies.

It was founded in 2007 with the mission "to be an academic institution which creates a model for Turkey and which is shown as a reference in the world, with its high level of excellence, culturally and socially well-equipped, dedicated to creating individuals who have ethical values, who are  modern, innovative and pioneering practitioners and who adhere to the principles of Ataturk".

Starting with a school of medicine, it added health sciences in 2009 and engineering in 2014, as well as faculties of arts and sciences – covering psychology, molecular sciences and genetics – and pharmacy.

The 35 acre Kareen Aydinlar Campus, named after Acıbadem Health Group’s founder, includes buildings which won awards from the Chicago-based Architectural Institute of America in 2015 and 2017 and which are LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certified.

It has a 278-bed university hospital with specialist chemotherapy and cardiovascular wards. Facilities include the clinical simulation and advanced level endoscopic-robotic surgery training centre (CASE), which is claimed to be "the world’s most comprehensive simulation centre".

Aiming to bring together all branches of science to pursue research into health and medicine, its innovations include the Department of Radiation Oncology’s in late 2018 of MRI guided radiation therapy for cancer combining MRI and linear acceleration technology. Research centres include one devoted to combatting crime and violence.

name: Adana Alparslan Türkeş Science and Technology University
description:
Situated in Southern Turkey, about 35km from the Mediterranean Sea, Adana Alparslan Türkeş Science and Technology University specialises in engineering and natural sciences.

Despite this specialisation, its seven faculties run the full academic spectrum: computer and informatics; engineering; business; aeronautics and astronautics; design and architecture; humanities and social sciences; and political sciences. There is also a vocational school of information technologies.

The campus includes a football field, an archery range, table-tennis tables and bicycle paths. Student clubs include theatre and music societies, an archery club, a chess club, an animal lovers’ society and an aviation society.

There are also student societies catering for niche interests, such as the defence industry and technologies student community and the financial technologies and capital markets student community.

name: Adelphi University
description: Adelphi University, New York, is dedicated to transforming students’ lives through small classes with world-class faculty, hands-on learning and innovative ways to support academic and career success. We offer students more than 60 undergraduate programs, more than 65 master’s degree and doctoral programs, and more than 35 certificate programs, with particular strength in our Core Four—Arts and Humanities, STEM and Social Sciences, the Business and Education Professions, and Health and Wellness. With record enrollments that have grown nearly 10 percent in three years, an increasingly diverse student body and faculty, and a personalized approach to learning, Adelphi serves almost 8,000 students from 43 states and 64 countries at our beautiful main campus in Garden City, New York—just 23 miles from New York City’s cultural and internship opportunities.

name: Adıyaman University
description:
Adıyaman University was founded in 2006 through a merger of the vocational schools and faculties of İnönü University, Gaziantep University and Harran University that were located in the province of Adıyaman.

The city of Adıyaman in south-eastern Turkey has a history that goes back to some of the earliest human settlements. Many archaeological and historical sites show traces of the civilisations that have come and gone.

Adıyaman University has four campuses over which are found more than a dozen faculties, a conservatory and other education and research centres. It hosts more than 17,000 students, including a large number of international students. Adıyaman offers degrees at undergraduate and postgraduate level.

The faculties include: medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, medicine, education, sciences, engineering, architecture, economics and administrative sciences, Islamic studies, agricultural sciences, tourism, fine arts, health sciences, agricultural sciences, and technology.

Among the courses students can take are: dentistry, pharmacy, education, archaeology, biology, physics, English language and literature, Turkish language and literature, chemistry, mathematics, history of art, sociology, economics, business administration, Islamic studies, environmental engineering, civil engineering, mechanical engineering, metallurgy and materials engineering, agricultural engineering, nursing, midwifery, medicine, and tourism management.

Adıyaman has been noted for its work to support disabled students.

The university participates in national and international exchange programmes, including Erasmus+, Farabi, and Mevlana. It also participates in international research projects.

name: Afyonkarahisar Health Sciences University
description:
Afyonkarahisar Health Sciences University was established in 2018 after a split from another institution.

Students can study across schools of dentistry, health sciences, medicine, nursing and pharmacy. Medical technicians are trained at three vocational schools.

The university's Health Research and Application Centre, which covers a whole range of treatments with particular expertise in physiotherapy, is a 627-bed facility with 1923 staff. It includes the GETAT Centre, which looks at the uses of complementary and traditional forms of medicine. A 100-bed Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation Unit is planned.

name: Afyon Kocatepe University
description:
Afyon Kocatepe University is based in the city of Afyonkarahisar, popularly known as Afyon.

It was established in 1992 on the basis of the Afyonkarahisar Finance and Accounting School, which was founded in 1974 and became an affiliate of Anadolu University in 1987.

The university has four campuses.

It has faculties of education, art and science, fine arts, law, economics and administrative science, engineering, sports science, technical education, theology, tourism, the Bolvadin Faculty of Applied Science, 11 vocational schools and four high schools.

The university has a wild animal hospital.

name: AIIMS Rishikesh
description:
AIIMS Rishikesh is part of the network of All India Institutes of Medical Science which is aimed at correcting regional health imbalances and providing reliable healthcare in previously under-served districts. They also aim to create facilities for quality medical education to produce a number of doctors and conduct research in the country relevant to the area.

The university was established in 2012. There are six institutions in the network in total.

The university is based in Rishikesh, an important Hindu pilgrimage city which sits on the River Ganges as it flows through the foothills of the Himalayas.

It describes itself as a "centre of excellence in medical education, training, health care and research imbued with scientific culture, compassion for the sick and commitment to the under-served".

It has grown steadily from its foundation, admitting more and more students over time. Training and provision in yoga, naturopathy and ayurvedic medicine is provided through the AYUSH centre.

Research is a big part of the institution and it aims to conduct research in biomedical sciences, epidemiology, understanding disease and testing healthcare education among other areas.

The university's hospital was opened with 200 beds and now has more than 1,000. Outpatient services – which now include 85 specialist clinics - were established in 2013, an emergency service in 2017 and radiotherapy from 2018. Degrees are available from undergraduate to postgraduate level.

The nursing college was the first AIIMS Nursing college to admit male students

Specialities include India’s only department of reconstructive and cosmetic-plastic gynaecology and there are plans to offer a dedicated qualification in high-altitude medicine.

name: Akita University
description: Established as a result of a merger between the Akita Normal School, the Akita Mining College and the Akita Youth Normal School, the Akita University (AU) was inaugurated in 1949. It began with a faculty of liberal arts and a mining college however, since 2014, it has been operating with four faculties. These are the faculty of international resource sciences, the faculty of education and human studies, the faculty of medicine and the faculty of engineering science. Four graduate schools were also set up: the graduate school of international resource sciences, the graduate school of education, the graduate school of medicine and the graduate school of engineering science. AU is therefore a combination of innovative research and education. There are three sites spread across Akita City: Tegata campus, Hodono campus and Hondo campus. It is highly selective in its admission policy and relies on entrance examinations and past academic records. Between 10-20 per cent of those who apply are accepted to study. Not only does AU focus on education and research, but it also works to provide for the community in the northern part of the Tohoku region. Part of its aim is to nurture and support talented youth and to pioneer research that will help the area. The implementation of education, research, social contribution, globalisation and management is under way with the AU Yoshimura Plan. On-campus facilities include: a library, a mining museum, a kindergarten, elementary school, junior school and a university hospital, which became an advanced treatment hospital in 1994.

name: Aksaray University
description:
Aksaray University was officially founded in 2006 but its origins can be traced back to 1986 when the Technical Sciences Vocational School was established. This school was a department of the Selçuk University and then the Nigde University when it opened in 1992. The university became Aksaray University in 2006.

The university is located in Aksaray, a city in the Central Anatolia region of Turkey. Aksaray is known as a transit town, particularly for those travelling between Ankara, Konya and Nevsehir. However it is also home to some historical buildings including the Grand Mosque, the Egri Minare (Turkey’s version of the Leaning Tower of Pisa) and the Kizil Minare Camii (mosque with a red minaret).

With 12 faculties on offer, there is an expansive range of courses available for students to study. These include education, engineering, and Islamic studies. The university also boasts 17 research centres, six vocational schools, three institutes, one college and one training and research hospital.

The Health, Culture and Sports Department is responsible for protecting the physical and mental health of the university’s students and stuff. This is achieved by ensuring that quality nutrition, shelter, sports, psychological counselling and guidance services are available to every member of the university.

The university’s International Office opened in 2007 and has since developed partnerships with a number of higher education institutes around the world. These partnerships help the university in its mission to create a multicultural campus by increasing the number of international students. These foreign partnerships also facilitate the exchange and collaboration of academic and scientific research.

name: Alanya Alaaddin Keykubat University
description:
Alanya Alaaddin Keykubat University (ALKÜ) is a public institution founded in 2015. It is named in honour of the Seljuk Sultan Alaeddin Keykubad, one of the sultans of the Seljuk Empire. The university holds the distinction of being the first state university established in a Turkish town, as opposed to in a provincial capital.

Located in Alanya, a city on Turkey’s Mediterranean coast roughly 135 km east of Antalya, the university’s campus sits in Kestel, a rapidly developing district.

Academically, the university comprises a wide range of faculties, including medicine, dentistry, education, economics, administrative and social sciences, engineering, aviation and space sciences, health sciences, sport sciences, art, design and architecture, and tourism.

There is also a Graduate Institute, as well as multiple vocational schools and language centres, which support a broad portfolio of academic pathways.

It has a lively campus culture featuring festivals, clubs, seminars, exhibitions, job fairs, technical trips, concerts, and entrepreneurship contests.

The university hosts international students from across the globe, teaching in Turkish and English, as well as options for German, Russian and Arabic study.

name: Alberto Hurtado University
description:
Universidad Alberto Hurtado or Alberto Hurtado University, often referred to as UAH, is a Jesuit university located in Santiago, Chile. The university is named after a famous Chilean Jesuit Saint, Father Alberto Hurtado, and was established in 1997.

The university offers undergraduate, graduate and PhD programmes in different disciplines through its six schools: psychology, education, philosophy and humanities, law, economics and business, and social sciences. The main language of instruction is Spanish.

Since its inception, the university has made social justice and international collaboration key missions of the institution. UAH has a Center for Reflection and Social Action (CREAS) founded in 1997, to foster reflection and social action throughout the university in pursuit of the Jesuit values.

It is a member of different organisations like the Ibero-American Observatory on Human Mobility, migration, and Development, the Association of Jesuit Universities in Latin America (AUSJAL), Chilean Chapter of Catholic Universities, and the Latin American Network of Social Engagement and University Volunteering (REDIVU).

It also has an Interdisciplinary Program on Migration Studies (PRIEM) to facilitate collaboration between different departments within the university on migrant-related issues.

name: Alexandru Ioan Cuza University
description:
Founded in 1860, Alexandru Ioan Cuza University is the oldest Romanian higher level education institution. The university is one of the most prestigious in the country, classified as a first league research and education centre by Romania’s Ministry of Education in 2011.

It offers degrees in biology, chemistry, law, economics, physical education, philosophy, social sciences, physics, history, geography and geology, mathematics,  IT, literature, psychology, theology and European studies. Although the university welcomes international students, courses are only available in Romanian. Students can, however, learn the language at Alexandru Ioan Cuza.

The university hosts the Museum of Alexandru Ioan Cuza University, honouring Romanian heritage starting with the Cucuteni prehistoric civilisation and ending with the institution’s notable alumni. The Natural History Museum, founded in 1834, also attracts visitors through its showcase of over 300,000 vegetal and animal specimens characterising Romanian climate.

The Botanical Garden, set up in 1856, is the largest in the country. The university’s Planetarium and Astronomic Observatory, built in 1913, provides further means of observing the outer world.

Iasi is one of the largest cities in Romania. It has a rich history as the crossroads between Polish, Hungarian, Russian and Ottoman tradesmen.

The city is an also an important cultural centre, hosting six universities, over sixty schools, two theatres, an opera house and many other cultural institutions. In Iasi’s immediacy, the Moldovan medieval monasteries such as Sucevita, Moldovita and Voronet, with external mural paintings, are recognised by UNESCO as World Heritage sites.

name: Al-Furat Al-Awsat Technical University
description:
Al-Furat Al-Awsat Technical University was established in 2014 and has four technical colleges and seven technical institutes. These colleges and institutes are distributed across five locations: Al-Muthanna, Al-Najaf, Babylon, Diwaniya and Karbala.

Courses are offered across technical diploma, technical bachelor, master's and PhD levels. The university is officially accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research for the Republic of Iraq, as well as the Technical Education Authority.

The university’s four technical colleges are: The Technical College of Health and Medicine, Technical College of Al-Mussaib, Technical College of Administrative and Management and the Technical College of Engineering. Its seven technical institutes are as follows: Technical Institute of Babylon, Technical Institute of Najaf, Technical Institute of Al-Mussaib, Technical Institute of Kufa, Technical Institute of Karbala, Technical Institute of AL–Qadasya, Technical Institute of Semawa.

Al-Furat Al-Awsat Technical University offers courses of either two-year duration or four-year duration, and does not offer any online courses. Morning and evening courses are also offered by the university to cater for part-time students.

Sustainability is at the forefront of the agenda, encouraging the use and construction of renewable energy sources on campus. The university also puts research on its main agenda, aspiring to be the scientific reference for future generations.

One of the main aims of the university is to develop students who have the ability to meet the needs of the market, therefore aiming to help its national community in the process. The university also prioritises supporting innovation and excellence.

The Careers and Employment team are in place to support students on their route to employment through putting them in touch with employers, building skills or writing CV’s.

name: Allameh Tabataba ’i University
description: Allameh Tabataba ’i University (ATU) was established in 1983 as after the merger of 24 independent colleges and universities, and is named after a great Iranian contemporary philosopher. Dedicated to law, management, political sciences, psychology, social sciences and media sciences, ATU offers academic programmes at all levels. It is the largest Iranian state university in humanities, is under the supervision of the Ministry of Science, Research, and Technology, and is well-known for its academic and research activities as well as regional and international relations.

name: Al-Muthanna University
description:
Al-Muthanna University was founded in 2007.

The university is located in Samawah, a city in Al-Multhanna Province, Iraq. Al-Multhanna Province is located in the south of the country, bordering Kuwait and Saudi Arabia. The province is named after the 7th century Arab general Al-Muthanna ibn Haritha.

There are 15 colleges at the university that specialise in a variety of scientific areas including dentistry, nursing, engineering, medicine, pharmacy, humanities, economy and administration, science, agriculture, law, physical education, and veterinary.

The university offers 34 undergraduate degree programmes and five graduate programmes that award a master’s degree in science, education, physical education, economy and administration, and agriculture. There are also three PhD degree programmes available in the fields of education, physical education and agriculture.

Outside the classroom students are encouraged to participate in the university’s extracurricular activities. There is a sports recreation centre where students can practice a range of indoor sports including gymnastics, football and basketball. The university also has a fully equipped five-ball stadium, which hosts an annual tournament for athletes from different universities.

Faculty members of the university are engaged in research and have published their findings in various international journals such as the Journal of Humanity Science.

In January 2021 the university hosted its first International Scientific Conference of Engineering in collaboration with Liverpool John Moores University in the UK. The conference included researchers and specialists from the fields of civil engineering, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering and materials engineering, architecture engineering, and electronic engineering.

name: Al-Nahrain University
description:
Established in 1987, Al-Nahrain University is located in Baghdad, the capital of Iraq.

The university has two different campuses, both in central Baghdad. There’s the main campus in Jadriya, which focuses on engineering, science, political science, information technology engineering and business economics. It also has biotechnology facilities including a biotechnology research centre, a renewable energy nanoparticles centre and a computer centre.

The other campus in Kadhimiyah includes schools of medicine, law and pharmacy. It’s also home to the higher institute for the diagnosis of infertility and assisted reproduction techniques.

Within these areas of study, students can gain both undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.

On campus, students will find dormitories as well as classrooms, a library and restaurants.

Al-Nahrain University has established relationships with universities around the world, carrying out various exchange activities such as academic exchanges, scientific research cooperation and the opportunity for students to study abroad.

name: Al-Qasim Green University
description:
Al-Qasim Green University is a relatively young institution having been established in 2012. It is located in Al-Qasim in the Babil province, around 80 miles south of Baghdad in Iraq.

It was started as part of a higher education ministry plan to create specialised institutions to drive development in Iraq’s regions.

It was initially called Al-Qasim Al-Khadra University. It started with faculties of agriculture and veterinary science from the nearby University of Babylon, along with newly-formed schools of biotechnology; food science; environmental science and water resource engineering.

The idea of it becoming Iraq’s Green university was founded on its location in the Euphrates region, where agriculture and animal husbandry are significant local industries.

It seeks to be “one of the leading local, regional and international universities in exploration, education and scientific research in terms of applying international standards in knowledge, education, scientific research  and community service.”

Its purpose-built campus is on a 100 hectare site which was formerly a brickworks. The architects referenced this in using brick as the main material for buildings which are arranged "as an ancient town" with major structures like the presidency, library, mosque and auditorium at the centre. The presidency was the first LEED Gold Standard building in Iraq, while campus transport is provided by electric vehicles and rented bikes.

Two further colleges - science and physical education and sports science - have been added to the original six. The Center for Teaching the Noble Qur’an is also one of the new centres at the university.

name: Al-Quds University
description:
Officially established in 1995, Al-Quds University is the first and only Palestinian University in Jerusalem. Its roots can be traced back to 1984 when several colleges in the Jerusalem area merged together. These colleges included the College of Hind Al-Husseini for Women, the Centre for Islamic Archaeology, and the College of Medical Professions and Science and Technology.

The university has two main campuses, a larger one in Abu Dis on the outskirts of Jerusalem, and a smaller one located in the Old City of East Jerusalem. It also has campuses situated in the areas of Beit Hanina, Sheikh Jarrah, and Rammalh (al-Bireh).

At the heart of the university are four core values: professionalism, equality and diversity, access to education, and the promotion of peace. By embodying these values the university seeks to provide a safe environment for its students and staff.

The university has 15 faculties and 29 institutes and centres. Included among these are the first medical school in Palestine, the first Research Center for Nanotechnology and the Institute of Jerusalem Studies which offers an MA on the ancient city. The Al-Quds Bard College for Arts and Sciences, aims to combine the best of American and Palestinian academic traditions. More than 45 of the university's departments offer postgraduate education.

The library has printed, audio-visual and electronic resources in addition to the manuscripts, films, discs and posters and nearly 100,000 catalogued books. Resources are in both English and Arabic.

The university has international partnerships with American and European universities and is also affiliated with over 30 institutes and carries out research in a number of different areas.

name: Altınbaş University
description:
Altınbaş University is a young and dynamic non-profit university founded by the philanthropic Mehmet Altınbaş Education and Culture Foundation in 2008.

It was established with the aim of taking its place among the leading universities in Turkey and beyond with an academic staff – mostly graduates of prestigious US or European PhD programmes – that is capable of and committed to undertaking research and providing education at an international level.

Altınbaş University provides its students with the opportunity to become productive, investigative and intellectual individuals as well as global citizens, who are respectful of human rights and individual freedoms, with a sense of social responsibility and endowed with intercultural skills.

The university offers 23 undergraduate programmes in eight schools: engineering and architecture; fine arts and design; economics and administrative sciences; law; arts and sciences; pharmacy; medicine; and dentistry.
